body_html: Numerical stability means the result of computation is more accurate. But when you have exploding gradients, the growth in magnitudes is a feature of your training procedure rather than numerical error. It's like putting i=i**2 in a loop, you are going to run out of range even if you use numerically stable implementation of square operator
